title: Jira
description: The Jira Cloud Platform REST API

get_application_properties.title: Returns all application properties or a single application property.
get_application_properties.description: Returns all application properties or a single application property.

get_application_properties_advanced_sett.title: Returns the application properties that are accessible on the Advanced Settings page. To navigate to the Advanced Settings page in Jira, choose the Jira icon > Jira settings > System, General Configuration and then click Advanced Settings (in the upper right).
get_application_properties_advanced_sett.description: Returns the application properties that are accessible on the Advanced Settings page. To navigate to the Advanced Settings page in Jira, choose the Jira icon > Jira settings > System, General Configuration and then click Advanced Settings (in the upper right).

put_application_properties__id_.title: Changes the value of an application property. For example, you can change the value of the jira.clone.prefix from its default value of CLONE - to Clone - if you prefer sentence case capitalization. Editable properties are described below along with their default values.
put_application_properties__id_.description: Changes the value of an application property. For example, you can change the value of the jira.clone.prefix from its default value of CLONE - to Clone - if you prefer sentence case capitalization. Editable properties are described below along with their default values.

get_applicationrole.title: Returns all application roles. In Jira, application roles are managed using the Application access configuration page.
get_applicationrole.description: Returns all application roles. In Jira, application roles are managed using the Application access configuration page.

get_attachment_meta.title: Returns the global attachment settings, that is, whether attachments are enabled and the maximum attachment size allowed.
get_attachment_meta.description: Returns the global attachment settings, that is, whether attachments are enabled and the maximum attachment size allowed.

delete_attachment__id_.title: Deletes an attachment from an issue.
delete_attachment__id_.description: Deletes an attachment from an issue.

get_attachment__id_.title: Returns the metadata for an attachment. Note that the attachment itself is not returned.
get_attachment__id_.description: Returns the metadata for an attachment. Note that the attachment itself is not returned.

get_attachment__id__expand_human.title: Returns the metadata for the contents of an attachment, if it is an archive, and metadata for the attachment itself. For example, if the attachment is a ZIP archive, then information about the files in the archive is returned and metadata for the ZIP archive. Currently, only the ZIP archive format is supported.
get_attachment__id__expand_human.description: Returns the metadata for the contents of an attachment, if it is an archive, and metadata for the attachment itself. For example, if the attachment is a ZIP archive, then information about the files in the archive is returned and metadata for the ZIP archive. Currently, only the ZIP archive format is supported.

get_attachment__id__expand_raw.title: Returns the metadata for the contents of an attachment, if it is an archive. For example, if the attachment is a ZIP archive, then information about the files in the archive is returned. Currently, only the ZIP archive format is supported.
get_attachment__id__expand_raw.description: Returns the metadata for the contents of an attachment, if it is an archive. For example, if the attachment is a ZIP archive, then information about the files in the archive is returned. Currently, only the ZIP archive format is supported.

get_auditing_record.title: Returns a list of audit records. The list can be filtered to include items:
get_auditing_record.description: Returns a list of audit records. The list can be filtered to include items:

get_avatar__type__system.title: Returns a list of system avatar details by owner type, where the owner types are issue type, project, or user.
get_avatar__type__system.description: Returns a list of system avatar details by owner type, where the owner types are issue type, project, or user.

post_comment_list.title: Returns the comments for a list of comment IDs.
post_comment_list.description: Returns the comments for a list of comment IDs.

get_comment__commentId__properties.title: Returns the keys of all the properties of a comment.
get_comment__commentId__properties.description: Returns the keys of all the properties of a comment.

get_comment__commentId__properties__prop.title: Returns the value of a comment property.
get_comment__commentId__properties__prop.description: Returns the value of a comment property.

put_comment__commentId__properties__prop.title: Creates or updates the value of a property for a comment. Use this resource to store custom data against a comment.
put_comment__commentId__properties__prop.description: Creates or updates the value of a property for a comment. Use this resource to store custom data against a comment.

post_component.title: Creates a component. Use components to provide containers for issues within a project. Permissions required: Any of the following:
post_component.description: Creates a component. Use components to provide containers for issues within a project. Permissions required: Any of the following:

delete_component__id_.title: Deletes a component. Permissions required: Any of the following:
delete_component__id_.description: Deletes a component. Permissions required: Any of the following:

get_component__id_.title: Returns a component. Permissions required: Browse projects project permission.
get_component__id_.description: Returns a component. Permissions required: Browse projects project permission.

put_component__id_.title: Modifies a component. Any fields included in the request are overwritten. If leadUserName is an empty string ("") the component lead is removed. Permissions required: Any of the following:
put_component__id_.description: Modifies a component. Any fields included in the request are overwritten. If leadUserName is an empty string ("") the component lead is removed. Permissions required: Any of the following:

get_component__id__relatedIssueCounts.title: Returns the counts of issues assigned to the component. Permissions required: Permission to access Jira.
get_component__id__relatedIssueCounts.description: Returns the counts of issues assigned to the component. Permissions required: Permission to access Jira.

get_configuration.title: Returns the global settings in Jira. These settings determine whether optional features (for example, sub-tasks, time tracking, and others) are enabled. If time tracking is enabled, this method also returns the time tracking configuration.
get_configuration.description: Returns the global settings in Jira. These settings determine whether optional features (for example, sub-tasks, time tracking, and others) are enabled. If time tracking is enabled, this method also returns the time tracking configuration.

get_configuration_timetracking.title: Returns the time tracking provider that is currently selected. Note that if time tracking is disabled, then a successful but empty response is returned.
get_configuration_timetracking.description: Returns the time tracking provider that is currently selected. Note that if time tracking is disabled, then a successful but empty response is returned.

get_configuration_timetracking_list.title: Returns all time tracking providers. By default, Jira only has one time tracking provider: JIRA provided time tracking. However, you can install other time tracking providers via apps from the Atlassian Marketplace. For more information on time tracking providers, see the documentation for the Time Tracking Provider module.
get_configuration_timetracking_list.description: Returns all time tracking providers. By default, Jira only has one time tracking provider: JIRA provided time tracking. However, you can install other time tracking providers via apps from the Atlassian Marketplace. For more information on time tracking providers, see the documentation for the Time Tracking Provider module.

get_configuration_timetracking_options.title: Returns the time tracking settings. This includes settings such as the time format, default time unit, and others. For more information, see Configuring time tracking.
get_configuration_timetracking_options.description: Returns the time tracking settings. This includes settings such as the time format, default time unit, and others. For more information, see Configuring time tracking.

get_customFieldOption__id_.title: Returns a custom field option. For example, an option in a cascading select list.
get_customFieldOption__id_.description: Returns a custom field option. For example, an option in a cascading select list.

get_dashboard.title: Returns a list of dashboards owned by or shared with the user. The list may be filtered to include only favorite or owned dashboards.
get_dashboard.description: Returns a list of dashboards owned by or shared with the user. The list may be filtered to include only favorite or owned dashboards.

get_dashboard__dashboardId__items__itemI.title: Returns the keys of all properties for a dashboard item.
get_dashboard__dashboardId__items__itemI.description: Returns the keys of all properties for a dashboard item.

get_dashboard__dashboardId__items__itemI.title: Returns the key and value of a dashboard item property.
get_dashboard__dashboardId__items__itemI.description: Returns the key and value of a dashboard item property.

put_dashboard__dashboardId__items__itemI.title: Sets the value of a dashboard item property. Use this resource in apps to store custom data against a dashboard item.
put_dashboard__dashboardId__items__itemI.description: Sets the value of a dashboard item property. Use this resource in apps to store custom data against a dashboard item.

post_expression_eval.title: Evaluates a Jira expression and returns its value.
post_expression_eval.description: Evaluates a Jira expression and returns its value.

get_field.title: Returns all issue fields in Jira, both system and custom fields.
get_field.description: Returns all issue fields in Jira, both system and custom fields.

get_field__fieldKey__option.title: Returns all options defined for a select list issue field. A select list issue field is a type of issue field that allows a user to select an value from a list of options.
get_field__fieldKey__option.description: Returns all options defined for a select list issue field. A select list issue field is a type of issue field that allows a user to select an value from a list of options.

post_field__fieldKey__option.title: Creates an option for a select list issue field.
post_field__fieldKey__option.description: Creates an option for a select list issue field.

get_field__fieldKey__option_suggestions_.title: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed and selected by the currently logged in user.
get_field__fieldKey__option_suggestions_.description: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed and selected by the currently logged in user.

get_field__fieldKey__option_suggestions_.title: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed by the currently logged in user.
get_field__fieldKey__option_suggestions_.description: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed by the currently logged in user.

delete_field__fieldKey__option__optionId.title: Deletes an option from a select list issue field.
delete_field__fieldKey__option__optionId.description: Deletes an option from a select list issue field.

get_field__fieldKey__option__optionId_.title: Returns an option from a select list issue field.
get_field__fieldKey__option__optionId_.description: Returns an option from a select list issue field.

put_field__fieldKey__option__optionId_.title: Updates an option for a select list issue field. If the option does not exist, a new option is created.
put_field__fieldKey__option__optionId_.description: Updates an option for a select list issue field. If the option does not exist, a new option is created.

delete_field__fieldKey__option__optionId.title: Deselects a select list issue field option in all issues that it has been selected in. A different option can be selected to replace the deselected option. The update can also be limited to a smaller set of issues by using a JQL query.
delete_field__fieldKey__option__optionId.description: Deselects a select list issue field option in all issues that it has been selected in. A different option can be selected to replace the deselected option. The update can also be limited to a smaller set of issues by using a JQL query.

get_filter.title: Returns all filters. Deprecated, use Search for filters that supports search and pagination. Permissions required: None, however only the following filters are returned:
get_filter.description: Returns all filters. Deprecated, use Search for filters that supports search and pagination. Permissions required: None, however only the following filters are returned:

post_filter.title: Creates a new filter. The new filter is not shared and not selected as a favorite. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira.
post_filter.description: Creates a new filter. The new filter is not shared and not selected as a favorite. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira.

get_filter_defaultShareScope.title: Returns the default sharing settings for new filters and dashboards for a user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).
get_filter_defaultShareScope.description: Returns the default sharing settings for new filters and dashboards for a user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

put_filter_defaultShareScope.title: Sets the default sharing for new filters and dashboards for a user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).
put_filter_defaultShareScope.description: Sets the default sharing for new filters and dashboards for a user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

get_filter_favourite.title: Returns the favorite filters of the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).
get_filter_favourite.description: Returns the favorite filters of the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

get_filter_my.title: Returns the filters owned by the calling user. If includeFavourites is true, the user's favorite filters are also returned. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).
get_filter_my.description: Returns the filters owned by the calling user. If includeFavourites is true, the user's favorite filters are also returned. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group).

get_filter_search.title: Search for filters. This method is similar to Get filters except that you can refine the results to include filters that have specific attributes. For example, filters with a particular name. Permissions required: None, however only the following filters are returned (if no search parameters are set):
get_filter_search.description: Search for filters. This method is similar to Get filters except that you can refine the results to include filters that have specific attributes. For example, filters with a particular name. Permissions required: None, however only the following filters are returned (if no search parameters are set):

delete_filter__id_.title: Delete a filter. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira, however the following rules govern what a user can delete:
delete_filter__id_.description: Delete a filter. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira, however the following rules govern what a user can delete:

get_filter__id_.title: Returns a filter. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission view the filter.
get_filter__id_.description: Returns a filter. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission view the filter.

put_filter__id_.title: Updates an existing filter. Use this method to update a filter's name, description, JQL, or sharing. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira, however the following rules govern what a user can update:
put_filter__id_.description: Updates an existing filter. Use this method to update a filter's name, description, JQL, or sharing. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira, however the following rules govern what a user can update:

delete_filter__id__columns.title: Reset the user's column configuration for the filter to the default. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.
delete_filter__id__columns.description: Reset the user's column configuration for the filter to the default. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

get_filter__id__columns.title: Returns the columns configured for a filter. The column configuration is used when the filter's results are viewed in List View with the Columns set to Filter. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.
get_filter__id__columns.description: Returns the columns configured for a filter. The column configuration is used when the filter's results are viewed in List View with the Columns set to Filter. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.

put_filter__id__columns.title: Sets the columns for a filter. Only navigable fields can be set as columns. Use Get fields to get the list fields in Jira. A navigable field has navigable set to true. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.
put_filter__id__columns.description: Sets the columns for a filter. Only navigable fields can be set as columns. Use Get fields to get the list fields in Jira. A navigable field has navigable set to true. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

delete_filter__id__favourite.title: Removes a filter as a favorite for the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.
delete_filter__id__favourite.description: Removes a filter as a favorite for the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

put_filter__id__favourite.title: Add a filter as a favorite for the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.
put_filter__id__favourite.description: Add a filter as a favorite for the calling user. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and permission to view the filter.

get_filter__id__permission.title: Returns the share permissions for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.
get_filter__id__permission.description: Returns the share permissions for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.

post_filter__id__permission.title: Add a share permissions to a filter. If you add a global share permission (i.e., all logged-in users or the public) it will overwrite all share permissions for the filter.Be aware that this method uses different objects for updating share permissions compared to Update filter. Permissions required: Share dashboards and filters global permission and the calling user must own the filter.
post_filter__id__permission.description: Add a share permissions to a filter. If you add a global share permission (i.e., all logged-in users or the public) it will overwrite all share permissions for the filter.Be aware that this method uses different objects for updating share permissions compared to Update filter. Permissions required: Share dashboards and filters global permission and the calling user must own the filter.

delete_filter__id__permission__permissio.title: Deletes a share permission from a filter. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and the calling user must own the filter.
delete_filter__id__permission__permissio.description: Deletes a share permission from a filter. Permissions required: Permission to log in to Jira (i.e., member of the users group) and the calling user must own the filter.

get_filter__id__permission__permissionId.title: Returns a share permission for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.
get_filter__id__permission__permissionId.description: Returns a share permission for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission. Permissions required: None, however the calling user must have permission to view the filter.

get_group.title: This resource is deprecated, use group/member.
get_group.description: This resource is deprecated, use group/member.

get_group_member.title: Returns all users in a group. Users are ordered by username.
get_group_member.description: Returns all users in a group. Users are ordered by username.

delete_group_user.title: Removes a user from a group. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission.
delete_group_user.description: Removes a user from a group. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission.

post_group_user.description: Adds a user to a group.

get_groups_picker.description: Returns a list of groups whose names contain a query string. A list of group names can be provided to exclude groups from the results.

get_groupuserpicker.title: Returns a list of users and groups matching a string. The string is used:
get_groupuserpicker.description: Returns a list of users and groups matching a string. The string is used:

post_issue.title: Creates an issue or, where the option to create sub-tasks is enabled in Jira, a sub-task. A transition may be applied, to move the issue or sub-task to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.
post_issue.description: Creates an issue or, where the option to create sub-tasks is enabled in Jira, a sub-task. A transition may be applied, to move the issue or sub-task to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

post_issue_bulk.title: Creates issues and, where the option to create sub-tasks is enabled in Jira, sub-tasks. Transitions may be applied, to move the issues or sub-tasks to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.
post_issue_bulk.description: Creates issues and, where the option to create sub-tasks is enabled in Jira, sub-tasks. Transitions may be applied, to move the issues or sub-tasks to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

get_issue_createmeta.title: Returns details of projects, issue types within projects, and, when requested, the create screen fields for each issue type for the user. Use the information to populate the requests in Create issue and Create issues.
get_issue_createmeta.description: Returns details of projects, issue types within projects, and, when requested, the create screen fields for each issue type for the user. Use the information to populate the requests in Create issue and Create issues.

get_issue_picker.title: Returns a list of suggested issues matching the auto-completion query for the user executing this request. This operation checks the user's history and browsing context to return issue suggestions.
get_issue_picker.description: Returns a list of suggested issues matching the auto-completion query for the user executing this request. This operation checks the user's history and browsing context to return issue suggestions.

delete_issue_properties__propertyKey_.title: Deletes a property value from multiple issues. The issues to be updated can be specified by filter criteria.
delete_issue_properties__propertyKey_.description: Deletes a property value from multiple issues. The issues to be updated can be specified by filter criteria.

put_issue_properties__propertyKey_.title: Sets a property value on multiple issues. The issues to be updated can be specified by a filter.
put_issue_properties__propertyKey_.description: Sets a property value on multiple issues. The issues to be updated can be specified by a filter.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey_.title: Returns the details for an issue.
get_issue__issueIdOrKey_.description: Returns the details for an issue.

put_issue__issueIdOrKey_.title: Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.
put_issue__issueIdOrKey_.description: Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.

put_issue__issueIdOrKey__assignee.title: Assigns an issue to a user. Use this operation when the calling user does not have the Edit Issues permission but has the Assign issue permission for the project that the issue is in.
put_issue__issueIdOrKey__assignee.description: Assigns an issue to a user. Use this operation when the calling user does not have the Edit Issues permission but has the Assign issue permission for the project that the issue is in.

post_issue__issueIdOrKey__attachments.description: Adds one or more attachments to an issue. Attachments are posted as multipart/form-data (RFC 1867).

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__changelog.title: Returns a paginated list of all updates of an issue, sorted by date, starting from the oldest.
get_issue__issueIdOrKey__changelog.description: Returns a paginated list of all updates of an issue, sorted by date, starting from the oldest.

post_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment.title: a string containing the issue id or key the comment will be added to
post_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment.description: a string containing the issue id or key the comment will be added to

delete_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment__id_.description: a string containing the issue id or key the comment belongs to

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment__id_.title: of the issue the comment belongs to
get_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment__id_.description: of the issue the comment belongs to

put_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment__id_.title: a string containing the issue id or key the comment belongs to
put_issue__issueIdOrKey__comment__id_.description: a string containing the issue id or key the comment belongs to

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__editmeta.description: Returns the edit screen fields for an issue that are visible to and editable by the user. Use the information to populate the requests in Edit issue.

post_issue__issueIdOrKey__notify.title: Creates an email notification for an issue and adds it to the mail queue.
post_issue__issueIdOrKey__notify.description: Creates an email notification for an issue and adds it to the mail queue.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__properties.title: Returns the URIs and keys of an issue's properties.
get_issue__issueIdOrKey__properties.description: Returns the URIs and keys of an issue's properties.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__properties__pro.description: Returns the key and value of an issue's property.

put_issue__issueIdOrKey__properties__pro.title: Sets the value of an issue's property. Use this resource to store custom data against an issue.
put_issue__issueIdOrKey__properties__pro.description: Sets the value of an issue's property. Use this resource to store custom data against an issue.

delete_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink.title: Deletes the remote issue link from the issue using the link's global ID.
delete_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink.description: Deletes the remote issue link from the issue using the link's global ID.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink.description: Returns the remote issue links for an issue. When a remote issue link global ID is provided the record with that global ID is returned, otherwise all remote issue links are returned.

post_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink.description: Creates or updates a remote issue link for an issue.

delete_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink__.title: Deletes a remote issue link from an issue.
delete_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink__.description: Deletes a remote issue link from an issue.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink__lin.title: Returns a remote issue link for an issue.
get_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink__lin.description: Returns a remote issue link for an issue.

put_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink__lin.title: Updates a remote issue link for an issue.
put_issue__issueIdOrKey__remotelink__lin.description: Updates a remote issue link for an issue.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__transitions.description: Returns either all transitions or a transition that can be performed by the user on an issue, based on the issue's status.

post_issue__issueIdOrKey__transitions.description: Performs an issue transition and, if the transition has a screen, updates the fields from the transition screen. Optionally, issue properties can be set.

get_issue__issueIdOrKey__votes.description: Returns details about the votes on an issue.

delete_version__id_.title: Deletes a project version. Deprecated, use Delete and replace version that supports swapping version values in custom fields, in addition to the swapping for fixVersion and affectedVersion provided in this resource. Alternative versions can be provided to update issues that use the deleted version in fixVersion or affectedVersion. If alternatives are not provided, occurrences of fixVersion and affectedVersion that contain the deleted version are cleared. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission.
delete_version__id_.description: Deletes a project version. If alternatives are not provided, occurrences of fixVersion and affectedVersion that contain the deleted version are cleared. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission.

put_version__id__mergeto__moveIssuesTo_.title: Merges two project versions. The merge is completed by deleting the version specified in id and replacing any occurrences of its ID in fixVersion with the version ID specified in moveIssuesTo. Consider using Delete and replace version instead. This resource supports swapping version values in fixVersion, affectedVersion, and custom fields. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission.

Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission.

post_version__id__removeAndSwap.title: Deletes a project version. Permissions required: Administer Jira global permission or Administer Projects project permission. Alternative versions can be provided to update issues that use the deleted version in fixVersion, affectedVersion, or any version picker custom fields. If alternatives are not provided, occurrences of fixVersion, affectedVersion, and any version picker custom field, that contain the deleted version, are cleared. Any replacement version must be in the same project as the version being deleted and cannot be the version being deleted.
